website_summaries.verdict: These shoes are a good pick for climbers who are either beginners or transitioning to intermediate climbs. Although some wear them for outdoor climbs, they are generally considered an indoor climbing shoe.
pros: Durable, comfortable suede upper with grippy rubber sole
Hook-and-loop closure for easy on-and-off access
cons: May run small, so  keep this in mind when ordering

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 36.5. My size in normal shoes is a solid 6. I thought these would stretch out a little after use, but 6 plus months later and they are still very tight. Overall, the quality of the shoe is good and the velcro is easy to get on and off just size up.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable climbing shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my mom for her birthday. They were so nice I had to buy myself a pair of Scarpas! We still love them after 2 years of use! Great climbing shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Hero

customer_reviews.title: Too tight, but probably would've loved them a half size up
customer_reviews.text: The shoes feel aggressive. I am normally 7-7.5 street size. The Reflex in 7 is painfully tight on the big toes, but about right for the other toes. The leather top has a great feel. The colors are not the most inspired, but the overall design is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Liana Joa

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but I will never order rockclimbing shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, but I will never order rockclimbing shoes on line again.... too many sizing issues are possible. Unless you can try on in a store!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Devlynn

customer_reviews.title: Trust all the reviews. Runs small.
customer_reviews.text: They're nice shoes they just run small. Order 1.5 sizes bigger
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Doria

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected, I have yet to have the opportunity to try them out, and break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: lovely shoes, yet a bit small
customer_reviews.text: They are lovely shoes. Beautiful design and color. However they do run small. I usually have a size 37 for street shoes, but irregular long toes so I go for 37,5 just to be sure, but it's still too small for me (yeh I suppose climbing shoes should be tighter than usual but not the kind of tight that hurts and prevents you from climbing). So if you like them do make a safe bet by ordering 1 size up. I have to return the shoes though since they are too small for me.
customer_reviews.author: Khoa

customer_reviews.title: I certainly liked the way these shoes felt but I need a ...
customer_reviews.text: I certainly liked the way these shoes felt but I need a larger size. I am a TRUE SIZE 7 and after reading the reviews, I ordered an 8. Still just a little too small so I am returning and purchasing a size 8.5. Order at least a full size to a full size and a half when purchasing these. I really enjoyed how they hugged my foot and the way the soles felt, just need for my toes not to be cramped.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cartner

customer_reviews.title: Back of the shoe sits higher than other brands and ...
customer_reviews.text: Back of the shoe sits higher than other brands and rubs my Achilles but I developed a callus after a few wears.
customer_reviews.author: new parent

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: it was too small for me and need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: the shoes are great but they are too small
customer_reviews.text: the shoes are great but they are too small, i got an equivalent to a size 8.5 and im usually a 7.5 sometimes 8 to be safe. 8.5 should have been more then big enough and it isnt :( i would return but i had no choice but to wear them for a bit so i most likely cant now. i already had the climb set up and they arrived the day of the climb so i had no choice. i do recommend the shoes, just be careful of the size.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K.

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, good for long climb
customer_reviews.text: Even though, not the most technical shoes, but that wasn't what i was after. I wanted a pair I can wear for a couple hours without having to remove them between climbs (I go indoor), this pair of shoes does just that. Comfortable, good fit to my feet. The only complain I have is that the rubber isn't very sticky, hopefully it gets better after a few wears.
customer_reviews.author: aprilfool

customer_reviews.title: nice , comfy but expensive for this kind of shoe
customer_reviews.text: I think the price was too high not to mention the tax i had to pay, i could buy better shoes adding a little bit more. I had scarpa before and they are not endurable, i had a hole on the toe after couple of months indoor climbing which wasnt very intensive.
customer_reviews.author: saidkamila

customer_reviews.title: Im normally a size 6 in normal shoes and 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Im normally a size 6 in normal shoes and 5.5 in heels so I got a 5.6 in this shoe since it does run a little small.
customer_reviews.author: ariella

product_meta.title: SCARPA Women's Reflex WMN-W
product_meta.description: Innovation and tradition share equally deep roots at SCARPA, a muti-generational, family-owned business whose headquarters and manufacturing facilities are in the same region of northern Italy where it was founded in 1938. SCARPA builds performance footwear for climbing, hiking, skiing, mountaineering, trail-running and other outdoor pursuits. Aside from being the Italian word for "shoe," SCARPA is an acronym for Societa Calzaturiera Asolana Riunita Pedemontana Anonima (Associated Shoe Manufacturing Company of the Asolo Mountain Area).
feature_bullets: Passive rubber rand offers classic performance and foot protection
Equally at home at the gym or the crag
Can be sized for performance or comfort
Sensitive enough for the steeps, stiff enough for the edging
